snippet: When David Denson came out, it was a first for an active player, but there are probably dozens of gay men playing for teams in the majors and minor leagues.
abstract: The Upshot; revelation from Milwaukee Brewers minor league rookie David Denson that he is gay made him first active MLB player to publicly come out, and journalists are taking to their keyboards to document human interest angle of Denson's story; baseball statisticians are putting their own slant on issue, noting significant odds that there are more than likely dozens of closeted gay men on rosters.
lead_paragraph: When David Denson came out, it was a first for an active player, but there are probably dozens of gay men playing for teams in the majors and minor leagues.

headline.print_headline: Only One Gay Player? More Likely Dozens
headline.main: A Gay Baseball Player, in Statistical Perspective
